problems.title: Display shows 'Filter' or blockage
problems.description: The screen flashes a filter icon and the vacuum stops.
solution_steps: Twist and remove the dust bin. Separate the fine dust mesh and wash it.
Ensure the micro filter (the green one) is completely dry (24h).
Check the extension pipe for blockages.

required_parts.name: Samsung Jet Micro Filter & Mesh Kit

problems.title: Battery Drains Too Fast
problems.description: Vacuum runs for 5 mins and dies.
solution_steps: If the battery is over 2 years old, swap it out.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the filter on a Jet 75 / 90 Cordless Stick?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement filter typically costs significantly less than a new $519 vacuum, and extending the life of your Samsung is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Jet 75 / 90 Cordless Stick needs a new filter?
faqs.answer: Common signs include reduced performance and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the filter on my Jet 75 / 90 Cordless Stick myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
